text:
CHAPTER 4-7
ABATEMENT  OF  DANGEROUS  BUILDINGS
4-7-1
UNIFORM CODE ADOPTED
The Uniform Code for the Abatement of Dangerous Buildings, its most recent edition as
published by the International Conference of Buildings Officials and as amended by
sections within this Chapter are hereby adopted by the City of Brandon.  A printed copy of
such code and the amendments shall be kept on file with the Municipal Finance Officer.
Legislative History:     
Authority:
Ordinance No. 121, §1, 
    
Try SDCL §§ 9-29-3, 9-32-1,
4/4/83.
    
9-37-2, 9-12-1. Compare SDCL
    
Ch. 9-42 and 9-54 generally.
4-7-2
DEFINITIONS
Whenever the phrase "building official" occurs in the code adopted by this chapter, the
same shall be construed to mean the director of inspections, the City health officer, the
director of the minimum housing code, the fire prevention officer, the building official,
their respective authorized representatives, or any other City official authorized by the
legislative body of this jurisdiction with the enforcement of this code.
When reference is made to any governmental title in the code adopted by this Chapter, the
title shall be construed to correspond with the governmental title designated by the laws of
the City of Brandon or the State of South Dakota.
Legislative History:
Authority:
Ordinance No. 121, §3,
Try SDCL §§ 9-29-3, 9-32-1, 
4/4/83.
9-37-2, 9-12-1. Compare SDCL 
Ch. 9-42 and 9-54 generally.
